title: Report: Ligado’s wireless network will interfere with Iridium and some GPS services
summary: An independent review of Ligado’s planned deployment of a terrestrial wireless network concluded that it will likely interfere with GPS signals and with space-based communications services provided by Iridium.

title: Maritime Launch Services breaks ground on Canada’s first orbital launch site
summary: Maritime Launch Services (MLS) in Canada has received approval to begin construction of Spaceport Nova Scotia within the framework of an Environmental Assessment approved in 2019.

title: HawkEye 360 plans new funding round as it positions to go public
summary: HawkEye 360 is looking at a new round of funding, and possibly going public in a couple of years, CEO John Serafini said Sept. 8.

title: NASA to Host National Space Council Meeting at Johnson Space Center
summary: NASA to Host National Space Council Meeting at Johnson Space Center

title: SpaceX to launch five spare Iridium satellites
summary: Iridium will launch five of its remaining six ground spare satellites on a Falcon 9 rideshare mission in 2023, the company announced Sept. 8.

title: Rocket Report: SLS launch targeted for late September, unique view of Falcon 9
summary: "I cannot see a rebuild of the cooperation we had in the past."

title: Private Chinese satellite internet firm GalaxySpace secures major new funding
summary: Chinese satellite internet startup GalaxySpace has raised new funding which the company says puts its value at $1.58 billion.

title: NASA preparing for late September Artemis 1 launch attempt
summary: NASA is laying the groundwork for another attempt to launch the Space Launch System on the Artemis 1 mission late this month, pending both repairs to leaking liquid hydrogen lines and negotiations with the Eastern Range.

title: Solid rocket startup Adranos opens fuel-production facility in Indiana
summary: Adranos, a startup that manufactures solid rocket motors, announced Sept. 8 it opened a fuel-production facility in Indiana.

title: Blue Canyon delivers first satellite bus for DARPA’s Blackjack constellation
summary: Blue Canyon Technologies delivered the first of 10 satellite buses DARPA ordered in 2020 for its Blackjack experiment in low Earth orbit.
